TopicTitle: What They Found in my Head...

Articles.Content: Good to hear the great news. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Welcome back! I have you in my prayers ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> At least you have the KSP community at your side.

Yes, if it will help you to have a rocket crashed short of its destination, be sure to let us know. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

That's good news and great to hear. Take your time, take it slow, things will get better with each passing day. Prayers to you.

Side note: The next time you see or talk to your doctor, ask if it's ok (or *when will it be ok*) for you to start taking probiotics. I would think after you're off the antibiotics. Antibiotics kill the bugs, but they also tend to kill the good bugs (in your gut) as well; Probiotics will help replenish the good bacteria (flora) and help with recovery and in general help keep you healthy. Look into it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I'm back... kinda. Been lurking a bit; but haven't had the energy to post.
> I was in the hospital until the 16th and had to be readmitted for meningitis. A week later, they let me out again. On the 28th (3 days later), I had to go back in again because My stitches loosened and I had a spinal fluid leek and was in for another week!
> 
> I have been back at the in-laws for 1 1\2 weeks (Cleaner than where I was living), on massive antibiotics and close watch.
> 
> I am very, very tired and still light headed to the point of confusion... probably the pressure in my head is lower than I have been used to and am not used to it. I feel like my head is full of water all the time.
> 
> Will try and keep posted.

Welcome back, man!

I know we can't do much to help you from here, but until you've recovered, at least you have an internet army ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Good luck, FR8. Glad to see you're on the road to recovery, even if it's going to take a while.

I love your sig, BTW. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'll crash a rocket for you tonight. ;-)
Welcome back! May you get better every day.
I hope you have a fast recovery.
I hope you get better soon ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Fingers crossed for you. Glad the surgery is done and best of luck with a swift and full recovery.

The worst injury to my head was a part of a toy airplane in my ear when I was 6 (no damage other than a cut). The worst thing to ever happen to me was projectile vomiting on vacation (yay). This is way worse. Pull through, and live a happy, (hopefully) soundfull life.

> 
> I'm back... kinda. Been lurking a bit; but haven't had the energy to post.
> I was in the hospital until the 16th and had to be readmitted for meningitis. A week later, they let me out again. On the 28th (3 days later), I had to go back in again because My stitches loosened and I had a spinal fluid leek and was in for another week!
> 
> I have been back at the in-laws for 1 1\2 weeks (Cleaner than where I was living), on massive antibiotics and close watch.
> 
> I am very, very tired and still light headed to the point of confusion... probably the pressure in my head is lower than I have been used to and am not used to it. I feel like my head is full of water all the time.

He has returned!

Don't know you too well, but welcome back man!
Good luck!
I wish you luck man!![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

> 
> The worst injury to my head was a part of a toy airplane in my ear when I was 6 (no damage other than a cut). The worst thing to ever happen to me was projectile vomiting on vacation (yay). This is way worse. Pull through, and live a happy, (hopefully) soundfull life.

How did you do that? Hope you get well Fr8monkey!
Hold on, Fr8monkey! You can go through this! May your recovery be speedy and may you live well after it! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Getting better and better... just slowly. Still dizzy and feels like I have my head filled with water some times.

Just found out yesterday when I had my second surgery, the 2 inch diameter piece of bone they took out because it wasn't healing right. Yes... that means I have a hole in my head... literally! ![ee5c60b4800289ba638b9b449da83d54.jpg](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/ee/5c/60/ee5c60b4800289ba638b9b449da83d54.jpg)

It may never heal properly.

It broke, and I didn't want my parents to get mad, so I tried to hide it. I figured my ear would be the best place. I was very dumb when I was little.

He's a KSP player, isn't he? I'm just assuming; 9.5/10 he's on the forums because he plays KSP.

No, my brain is old and doesn't respond to training very well.
Is the recovery going well?
